captions.text:
Vsauce, I’m Jake and I feel unmotivated.com.
So I just use one of the menu screens from

the Halo series with that epic music to give
me the energy to show you more DONGs...things
you can Do Online Now, Guys.

Journey to the edge of space with Eyes in
Space a beautiful 360 degree ride to our outer

atmosphere. It’s kinda a long trip so on
the way learn some color facts using This

is Color, an incredibly interesting interactive
site that drops some cool knowledge like how

brown is classified as a low intensity shade
of orange or that purple dye used to be made

from boiling thousands of marine snails. *Gary
meows*

Once you get back from Space venture into
This Exquisite Forest, a music generator where

you adjust if you want your song to be happy,
sad, acoustic, or have bass all in order to

create a really great piece of music. Visualize
those jams with a diamond skull that reacts

to the beat of a song. Adjust the parameters
to warp it or restrain it.

But let’s go inside that skull and play
with your mind in Gentle Brain...and try to

keep it from falling because a mind is a terrible
thing to waste. Or you can lose your whole

head in Ichabot Crane, a portal-esque puzzle
game where you throw your noggin around as

a way to solve different levels. Once you
get your head back, make sure everything still

works by testing your hearing. My Hearing
Test has you listen to audio bytes at differing

volumes to try and determine where your hearing
lies, from normal to severe hearing loss.

The results might surprise you...mine did.
Curse you years of playing DDR 1812 Overture
Edition!

Relax your ears with Pictures For Sad Children.com...which
isn't as bad as it sounds. All ya need now

is some Rain, Rhythm and Soul, an incredibly
chill site that plays jazz, instrumental,

or hip-hop tracks accompanied by the sounds
of rain. Take your relaxation to the extreme

with Cat Petting Simulator 2014 an edge of
your seat text game where you pet a cat (and

more). After cat petting go Catfishing where
you try and guess the Wikipedia article using
only the given categories.

After doing that, write something on the Wall
of Text for the world to see. Or make the

wall private for only your friends to see.
If you’d rather express yourself through

sound there’s Crumbles. Type what you want
to hear and then it will be constructed and

spoken using various movie, TV and Cartoon
Hangover clips. ‘It’s pretty freaking

awesome”. Take your favorite clip and tattoo
it onto a banana. If you make a mistake you

can always Take me Back, which shows you what
was happening on the day you were born, like

what magazine covers were out or what music
was toppin the charts.

Since we’re back in time lets boot up some
Windows 93, with a variety of different apps

to explore like the always useful Totally
not a virus. Trust me I’m a dolphin and

the Star Wars app which plays a New Hope entirely
in ASCII characters.

And I know you’re dying to see more videos
in this format so GOOD NEWS, you can watch

all your favorite YouTube videos in ASCIItube!
You can hardly see the pixels.

Since we’re being old school might as well
have a Retro Uprising. Play games from systems

like the N64, Atari 2600, Sega Genesis and
Turbografx. They even have the game Alf. It’s

beautiful. But why play those old pixelate
games when you could play GAME OF THE YEAR

420BLAZEIT. Load up on Mountain Dew and Doritos
then blast your way through enemies whipping
out 360 no scopes all day.

For something a little more mentally stimulating
try Math Effect, a strategy game that has

you defending your base from attackers. Every
move a piece makes increases its strength

so you have to defeat them before they overpower
you when their paths cross...code. Cross Code

is a puzzle based action RPG built in HTML5.
It has a really nice visual style, an interesting
story and the demo for it was just released.

Let me know what you thought of this DONG
by using an emoticon from dongerlist, which

has over 830 dongers and to go with these
things you can do online now guys, there is

a JAM, a Just Awesome Music leanback that
I made, over on WEsauce so you can listen

to some JAMs while you check out some DONGs
and as always, thanks for watching.
